editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Fellows of Merton College .

msItem.note: fol. 1 is filled with distinctiones and notes in tiny anglicana hands of s. xiii, including one on the necessity of masses for the dead, with a story concerning Bishop Theodolus, and another ‘contra adulteros’, quoting a Life of S. Germanus and a story of two nuns. On fol. 1v is a note on the number of years from Creation to the Incarnation, and 7 lines of verse, beg. ‘Qui plus expendit quam lucri summa reprehendit’ (WIC 15605).
On fol. 2rv a sermon on ‘Adam ubi es?’ in an early anglicana hand, beg.:
Table of the Gospels and epistles for the Sundays of the year cross-referenced to the capitula

msItem.author: ?NICHOLAS BYARD OP
msItem.title: Summa de Abstinentia
msItem.incipit: Abstinencia. Duplex est abstinencia detestabilis et laudabilis
msItem.explicit: (Vita) que preparauit Deus electis suis ad que nos ...
msItem.note: A later hand adds ‘Expliciunt distinctiones Parisiensis’. 133 chapters; Bloomfield 1841; pr. Paris 1512 &c. At the head of fol. 7, cropped, is ‘Distinctiones Parisiensis’, s. xv, below, ‘Distinctiones Parisienses Bonauenturae’, s. xvii. Some later annotation; the distinctio-numbers added as running heads.

msItem.title: De Sacramentis
msItem.incipit: Infirmitatem contractam per peccatum primorum parentum
msItem.explicit: quanta erit hec dilectacio solus Deus scit qui ..
msItem.note: A contemporary anglicana hand heads it ‘Incipit Tractatus Hugonis de sancto Victore super sacramentis ecclesiae’, the author’s name cancelled and ‘Bonauenture’ substituted by a slightly later hand.
Unpr.; Bloomfield 2748, citing two English copies, not this one.

msItem.title: A short note
msItem.incipit: Notandum quod fides debet esse uiua simpliciter et integra
msItem.explicit: quod cantatur ad primam Quicumque uult.

msItem.note: fol. 138rv filled with notes and sermons as fol. 2rv, much effaced on the verso. One sermon beg.:
msItem.incipit: Ascendam in palmam. Karissimi uerba sunt Salomonis in persona Dominum Deum loquentis

supportDesc.extent:
138 leaves 270 180
210 125
The edges retrimmed affecting marginalia, and spattered with red.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with pencil in 2 cols of 40 lines.

handDesc.handNote: One English gothic rotunda bookhand for art. 1, another for its prefatory matter. Art. 2 is in a comparatively old-fashioned bookhand, smaller and using a thinner pen.

decoDesc.decoNote: Red initials, paraphs, highlighting and underlining. The work is rather rough.

binding.p: Standard Merton s. xvii; sewn on four bands; formerly chained from the usual position. The last leaf was formerly a pastedown.

history.provenance: On fol. 2v ‘Liber domus scolarium de Mertone ex dono M. Roberti Wyght’. For Whyte, fellow c. 1424, no longer in 1433, see MS 20.
At the head of fol. 7 is the James no. ‘164’, s. xvii in., cropped.
Inside the front board is a sheet of paper with ‘D. 5, 6’ (canc.), and contents, s. xvii, ‘O. 3. 16. Art:’, canc and replaced with ‘M. 1. 12 (CXLIV)’ in red; the College bookplate.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.
